title: Practice Challenge
description:
Simulate Prisma relations:

1. Create a schema object with three models:
   - Author (id, name, books array)
   - Book (id, title, authorId, author)
   - Category (id, name, books array)
2. Set up a one-to-many relation: Author → Books
3. Set up a many-to-many relation: Books ↔ Categories
4. Create sample data showing:
   - One author with multiple books
   - Books connected to multiple categories
5. Create a function `getAuthorWithBooks(authorId)` that returns author with their books
6. Display the relational data

You're simulating Prisma's relation system!

hints.text: Use filter() for one-to-many, arrays for many-to-many relationships

commonMistakes.consequence: Relation references a field that doesn't exist, causing schema validation errors.
commonMistakes.correction: Add the foreign key field: authorId Int alongside the author User relation.

commonMistakes.mistake: Wrong array syntax for one-to-many relations
commonMistakes.consequence: Missing brackets means single relation, not array of related items.
commonMistakes.correction: Use Post[] for arrays on the 'one' side: posts Post[]
